metadata.metaValue: This is the most expensive part but doesn't need to be constantly updated. Better would be to have this in its own graph instead.
Reduce fur down to a few strands, these will be used as the source for big clumps. Also adding some displacement so the clumps aren't just straight.
Second pass for making smaller clumps.
Add high and low freq displacement
fur_stray_weights is for selecting just a small percentage of strands to be affected by whatever it's driving.
Compute unbend to slightly straighten fur

**The fur module of this library is very much a WIP!** 
The goal something like an xgen alternative for procedural hair/fur, this scene is just to demo what works so far.


As of the making of this I'm experimenting with styling compounds. Many crucial functions, like attatching fur to an animated mesh, have yet to be addressed.
